Chapter 1 [Hunter Buchanan]57-hunter did n’t believe in love at first sight . Hell , [he]57-hunter did n’t much believe in love at all . But the moment [he]57-hunter ’d seen the tall redhead standing in the foyer of [one of [[his]57-hunter empty houses]210-his empty houses]209-one of his empty houses , a box of books in [her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before arms and a skeptical look on [her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before face , [he]57-hunter ’d felt . . . something . [She]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before ’d been bold and fearless with [her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before words , something that attracted [him]57-hunter as [a man who clung to the shadows]211-a man who clung to the shadows . And when [she]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before ’d admitted to [[her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before quiet friend]212-her quiet friend that [most men]213-most men bored [her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before and [she]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before wanted something different in a relationship than just a pretty face ? [Hunter]57-hunter knew [she]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before was meant for [him]57-hunter . [She]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before was pretty , young , and single . [She]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before had a smart mind and a sharp tongue . [He]57-hunter liked that about [her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before . [She]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before was unafraid and laughed easily . Days had passed since [he]57-hunter ’d glimpsed at [her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before and [he]57-hunter still could n’t get [her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before out of [his]57-hunter mind . [She]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before haunted [his]57-hunter dreams . [Hunter]57-hunter was smart and rich and only a few years older than [her]207-the unusual woman who had been there minutes before . It should n’t have been unattainable . Unconsciously , [he]57-hunter touched the deeply gouged scars on [his]57-hunter face , [his]57-hunter fingers tracing the thick line at the corner of [his]57-hunter mouth where damaged tissue had been reconstructed . There was one thing preventing [Hunter]57-hunter from pursuing [a woman like that]214-a woman like that . [His]57-hunter face . [His]57-hunter hideous , scarred face . [He]57-hunter could hide the scars on [his]57-hunter chest and arm with clothing . [He]57-hunter could clench [his]57-hunter hand and [no one]215-no one would notice that [he]57-hunter was missing a finger . But [he]57-hunter could n’t hide [his]57-hunter face . When [he]57-hunter chose to leave [[his]57-hunter house]216-his house , [people]160-people crossed [the street]218-the street to avoid [him]57-hunter . [Men]219-men frowned as if there were something unnerving about [him]57-hunter . [Women]188-women flinched away from the sight of [him]57-hunter . Just like [the woman next to [him]57-hunter currently]221-the woman next to him currently was doing . [Brontë]59-brontë , [[Logan]55-logan ’s big - eyed girlfriend]222-logan ’s big - eyed girlfriend , sat next to [him]55-logan at [the [Brotherhood]60-brotherhood ’s poker table]223-the brotherhood ’s poker table . [The dark basement]224-the dark basement was filled with a haze of cigar smoke and the scent of liquor . Normally [the room]225-the room was filled with [[his]55-logan five best friends]226-his five best friends , but [they]226-his five best friends ’d gone [upstairs]227-upstairs to talk to [Logan]55-logan about the fact that [he]55-logan ’d brought [[his]55-logan new girlfriend]228-his new girlfriend with [him]55-logan to a secret society meeting . [Brontë]59-brontë had stayed behind with [him]55-logan . It was clearly not by [her]59-brontë choice , either . [He]725-he did n’t even stir . [She]58-gretchen sighed , carefully placing the letter back in the trunk and stripping off [her]58-gretchen plastic gloves . At least it was close to dinnertime . Strange how the project [she]58-gretchen ’d been so excited about had turned out to be a total snooze - fest , and the billionaire [she]58-gretchen ’d initially thought to avoid turned out to be the highlight of [her]58-gretchen day . Over the past week , [Gretchen]58-gretchen had woken up early , dressed ( well , sometimes ) , and headed to [the library]1995-the library to dutifully work on the project . Each letter was opened up , attached to a specialized clipboard with delicate care , and then transcribed . Of course , that was going to be a bit trickier than [she]58-gretchen ’d anticipated . The letters were boring as hell . Written in a tight , crabby script , [Ms. Lulabelle Vargas]94-lulabelle droned on and on to a [Mister Benedict Benthwick]95-ben about the weather in [Rochester]32-rochester . [He]57-hunter slammed a hand into a delicate Chinese ginger jar , pleased when it launched off the end table and smacked into the wall . Good . Now it was as shattered as [he]57-hunter felt inside . How could [he]57-hunter possibly explain to [another person]762-another person the event that had destroyed [his]57-hunter life ? [He]84-eldon said nothing , simply waited . [Hunter]57-hunter ran a hand down [his]57-hunter face , suddenly weary . “ Send [the cleaning crew]1960-the cleaning crew in [this wing]1958-this wing tomorrow . ”[57-hunter] “ Of course . ”[57-hunter] “ That ’ll be all . ”[84-eldon] [Hunter]57-hunter turned , heading toward [[his]57-hunter room]570-his room . Chapter 6 One week later The trouble with a flirt battle was that [both parties]863-both parties had to actively participate . [Both parties]863-both parties had to know how to actually flirt . And [Gretchen]58-gretchen had been flirting [her]58-gretchen head off , but [she]58-gretchen was getting nowhere fast . It was n’t that [Hunter]57-hunter was n’t interested . [Her]58-gretchen pleasure at showing [him]57-hunter [her]58-gretchen cooking had been deflated by the fact that [he]57-hunter ’d looked as if [he]57-hunter ’d wanted to escape [the room]225-the room . Delicate , scented blooms that were thoughtfully selected for [her]58-gretchen , along with a note inviting [her]58-gretchen to dinner . [She]58-gretchen ’d declined it once or twice , just to see how [he]57-hunter ’d react . [He]57-hunter had n’t reacted at all . And that had been even more frustrating . [She]58-gretchen ’d tried being sexy . All [she]58-gretchen ’d gotten was an abrupt suggestion that [she]58-gretchen take a shower and [him]57-hunter turning away . Not exactly the reaction [she]58-gretchen ’d wanted . [She]58-gretchen was utterly mystified . How could [she]58-gretchen break through to [him]57-hunter ? [She]58-gretchen supposed [she]58-gretchen could state it baldly . [Gretchen]58-gretchen chuckled to [herself]58-gretchen , then headed to [her]58-gretchen desk . And stopped , [her]58-gretchen heart dropping . Chapter 12 [She]58-gretchen ’d lied to [him]79-igor the entire time . The agony of it tore through [Hunter]57-hunter all night . [Gretchen]58-gretchen clearly had a price tag and [he]79-igor could pay it . And over time , perhaps the ache of it would go away . [He]79-igor ’d simply have to become better at hiding [his]79-igor own emotions . * * * After a fitful night of sleep , [Hunter]57-hunter awoke and dressed in one of [his]57-hunter more somber suits . [She]58-gretchen sighed , as if defeated . “ Good - bye , [Hunter]57-hunter . ”[79-igor] “ Wait . ”[79-igor] [He]79-igor stopped [her]58-gretchen when [she]58-gretchen tried to move past [him]79-igor . “ [You]58-gretchen need to hear what [I]58-gretchen ’m going to say . ”[58-gretchen] A wary hope shone in [her]58-gretchen eyes and [she]58-gretchen paused , setting down [her]58-gretchen suitcase . “ What is it ? ”[57-hunter] [Hunter]57-hunter studied [her]58-gretchen upturned face , which was so lovely . Quit yelling . ”[56-audrey] “ [I]56-audrey ’m not yelling ! ”[None-None] [Audrey]56-audrey bellowed , then winced when [the neighbor]733-the neighbor pounded on the wall in response . Frustrated , [Audrey]56-audrey grabbed [Daphne]70-daphne ’s suitcase and hauled it to [the bedroom]622-the bedroom . Fine then . [[Her]56-audrey twin]2431-her twin wanted to be like that ? [Audrey]56-audrey would n’t give [her]56-audrey a choice in the matter . [She]56-audrey ’d simply have to take control again and save [Daphne]70-daphne from [herself]56-audrey . Tossing the suitcase on [her]56-audrey bed , [she]56-audrey returned to [the living room]1771-the living room to grab [Daphne]70-daphne ’s purse . [Daphne]70-daphne snored , oblivious to [Audrey]56-audrey ’s movements . [Audrey]56-audrey snagged the purse , returned to the bed , and dumped the contents out . The usual clutter fell onto the bedspread — half a protein bar , three lipsticks , a few pens , hair clips , and credit cards . Several prescription bottles fell out as well , and [Audrey]56-audrey bit [her]56-audrey lip , frowning as [she]56-audrey read the names . Two of them were n’t [hers]56-audrey . [She]56-audrey flushed those , along with the small baggy of white powder [she]56-audrey found . [Daphne]70-daphne would be pissed when [she]70-daphne woke up , but [Audrey]56-audrey did n’t care . [[Her]56-audrey twin]2431-her twin could just get pissed . Next , [she]56-audrey searched the luggage and found several more pill bottles under different names , more drugs , and a thick packet tucked into the liner of [her]56-audrey suitcase . It all went into the garbage , and with every item tossed , [Audrey]56-audrey grew more and more determined . [Daphne]70-daphne wanted [Audrey]56-audrey ’s help in getting clean ? [She]56-audrey was willing to help , but [she]56-audrey was pretty sure [Daphne]70-daphne was n’t going to appreciate it . And that was too damn bad for [Daphne]70-daphne , because [Audrey]56-audrey was in this for the long haul . [She]56-audrey returned to [the living room]1771-the living room and watched [Daphne]70-daphne . Makeup was smeared across [Daphne]70-daphne ’s delicate features , and [her]70-daphne mouth hung open as [she]70-daphne slept . [Audrey]56-audrey would get [[her]56-audrey twin]2431-her twin back . No ifs , ands , or buts . [Daphne]70-daphne would be furious and threaten [her]56-audrey , but it did n’t matter . [Audrey]56-audrey had to do this once and for all , because it felt as if [she]56-audrey ’d already lost [Daphne]70-daphne .

[Jessica Clare]53-jessica clare also writes as [Jill Myles]140-jill myles and [Jessica Sims]141-jessica sims . As [Jessica Clare]53-jessica clare , [she]53-jessica clare writes sexy contemporary romance .
